TextEquiv.Unicode: But at the tabernacle in Silo, and spe
cially in the city of Jerusale there was
a schoole surpassing all other, & in ma
ner of an universitie, as they call them
now adaies.
And the same holie historie witnes
seth that most famous men had the go
vernment of those schooles. For wee
read in Kama that samuel, who was
the verie chiefest in all wisedome, god
lines, and learning, was governour
and principal of Naioth, that is to say,
ye Burse (as they terme it) or Colledge
of Prophetes. Helias and Heliieus
the most cleare lightes of the Church
of Israel, were rules over the schoole
of Hierico and Gilgal. That naugh
tie Jeroboam did pul downe ye schooles
and tread under foote the order of the
Priests, and places without all choice
some that were of the refuse of the
people in their places.
But the men of God Helias and He
liseus knew wel, that without schooles
the sound docrine could not flourish or
be preserved: and therefore they ap
plyed their selves wholly to the renu
ing of schooes. And when lawfull tri
butes were denied them, being by wic
ked Princes bestowed upon flatterers
and bellies, that is to say, priests of the
Tools of calves & of Baal: yet it came
to passe by the goodnes of the Lord, that
some good men bestowed somewhat
upo such as were desirous of learning,
who holding them selves contented
with a meane living, behaved them
selves valianily in that most corrupt
age. But those notable men, those wise
men & prophetes, who had the govern
met over schooles, were called fathers,
whereuppon also their disciples and
scholers were termed the sonnes of the
prophetes.
Amos and Jeremiei call them Para
sites. for, saith Amos, I am no pro

But at the tabernacle in Silo, and spe cially in the city of Jerusale there was a schoole surpassing all other, & in ma ner of an universitie, as they call them now adaies. And the same holie historie witnes seth that most famous men had the go vernment of those schooles. For wee read in Kama that samuel, who was the verie chiefest in all wisedome, god lines, and learning, was governour and principal of Naioth, that is to say, ye Burse (as they terme it) or Colledge of Prophetes. Helias and Heliieus the most cleare lightes of the Church of Israel, were rules over the schoole of Hierico and Gilgal. That naugh tie Jeroboam did pul downe ye schooles and tread under foote the order of the Priests, and places without all choice some that were of the refuse of the people in their places. But the men of God Helias and He liseus knew wel, that without schooles the sound docrine could not flourish or be preserved: and therefore they ap plyed their selves wholly to the renu ing of schooes. And when lawfull tri butes were denied them, being by wic ked Princes bestowed upon flatterers and bellies, that is to say, priests of the Tools of calves & of Baal: yet it came to passe by the goodnes of the Lord, that some good men bestowed somewhat upo such as were desirous of learning, who holding them selves contented with a meane living, behaved them selves valianily in that most corrupt age. But those notable men, those wise men & prophetes, who had the govern met over schooles, were called fathers, whereuppon also their disciples and scholers were termed the sonnes of the prophetes. Amos and Jeremiei call them Para sites. for, saith Amos, I am no pro
phet, neither the sonne of a Prophet,
to wit, not brought up in the know
ledge of liberall artes. And the same
man saieth againe: I have raysed up
of your sonnes for Prophetes, and of
your young me for Nazarites. But Je
remie commandeth also the manner of
them that studied, which in his lamen
tations he bewayleth to be altogether
perished in the captivitie. Further
more, they are called the sonnes of the
Prophets, for the affection which they
bare towards their schoole maisters, as
if they had beene their parents, and for
their obedience and daylie studie to
wardes them.
But how much the more noble and
wise the Princes were, so much the
more diligence they imployed in repai
ring schooles, and restoring Ecclesiasti
ciall order. Which a man may see, not
in David and Salomon onely, but al
so in Jolaphat, Ezechias, and Josias,
who were most vertuous and most
happie Princes. In the captivitie and
after the captivitie of Babylon, the
Lordes people was dispersed and scat
tered into many kingdomes farre and
wide.But whither to ever they were
carried, they erected scholes or synago
gues. and when the citie of Jerusalem
was restored, then they often came un
to the same. For therefore the Actes
of the Apostles make mention, that at
what time Saint Paul preached the
worde of God among the Gentiles,
hee went into the Synagogues and
taught.
And Saint James the Apostle
sayeth, Moses in olde time hath in
everie citie them that preach him in
the synagogues. Where he speaketh
not of the cities of Judea and Galilee,
but of the cities of the Gentiles, in Sy
ria, Cilicia and Asia. But that which
we reade in the Actes doth shewe that

phet, neither the sonne of a Prophet, to wit, not brought up in the know ledge of liberall artes. And the same man saieth againe: I have raysed up of your sonnes for Prophetes, and of your young me for Nazarites. But Je remie commandeth also the manner of them that studied, which in his lamen tations he bewayleth to be altogether perished in the captivitie. Further more, they are called the sonnes of the Prophets, for the affection which they bare towards their schoole maisters, as if they had beene their parents, and for their obedience and daylie studie to wardes them. But how much the more noble and wise the Princes were, so much the more diligence they imployed in repai ring schooles, and restoring Ecclesiasti ciall order. Which a man may see, not in David and Salomon onely, but al so in Jolaphat, Ezechias, and Josias, who were most vertuous and most happie Princes. In the captivitie and after the captivitie of Babylon, the Lordes people was dispersed and scat tered into many kingdomes farre and wide.But whither to ever they were carried, they erected scholes or synago gues. and when the citie of Jerusalem was restored, then they often came un to the same. For therefore the Actes of the Apostles make mention, that at what time Saint Paul preached the worde of God among the Gentiles, hee went into the Synagogues and taught. And Saint James the Apostle sayeth, Moses in olde time hath in everie citie them that preach him in the synagogues.
